span.p: Engine is the central I/O processing unit, redundantly built for high availablity. It consists of redundant directors ( director A and director B) that each contain multi-core CPUs, memory modules, and attach interfaces to universal I/O modules, such as front-end, back-end, InfiniBand, compression, and flash I/O modules.

Engine cooling fans and power supplies can be accessed from the front, the I/O modules and the management module and control station can be accessed from the rear. Since the number of universal I/O modules used in the engine depends on the required functionality and the system storage capacity, some slots can remain unused.
The engine rear view, I/O module slots, the physical and logical port numbering are depicted below.
The following table explains engine slot population rules:

tr.td: Optional, depends on the array’s storage capacity. Reserved for flash.
Any Fibre Channel, or Ethernet I/O module can occupy this slot.
Optional. Any Fibre Channel or Ethernet I/O module can occupy this slot.
Optional, depends on the array's storage capacity, reserved for flash.
Optional. Any Fibre Channel, or Ethernet I/0 module can occupy this slot.
Optional. Any Fibre Channel, Ethernet, or Compression I/0 module can occupy this slot.
